title: Cloud Systems Engineer
content:
At NICE, we don’t limit our challenges. We challenge our limits. Constantly. We’re relentless. We’re ambitious. And we make an impact. Our NICErs bring their A game and spend each day turning it into an A+. And if you’re like us, we can offer you the kind of challenge that will light a fire within you.NICE is seeking a VMware Engineer to help support our rapidly growing customer base.  This position will be responsible for assisting in the design, deployment, maintenance and documentation of the entire production VMware Infrastructure including Horizon View (VDI).   In addition, you will be deploying virtual machines for Windows and Linux Server operating systems on a regular basis.  We want someone who has a thirst for technology and has a desire to learn and grow, both individually, with the team, and the business.
 
Required Skills:
5+ years VMware vCenter Server experience
5-7+ years MS Windows Server 2016/2019/2022 experience
4 years of technical experience creating design specifications, implementing, and supporting server hardware
Experience installing, monitoring and troubleshooting VMware, Active Directory, Group Policy, DNS, DHCP
Experience building and managing vCenter Server and ESXi hosts, preferably in VMware 7.x and 8.x
Experience with VMware Horizon View
Experience with VMWare vRealize Suite
Capacity Planning for the VMware Environment
Applying technical knowledge of networks, operating systems, utilities, etc. to the VMware environment
Troubleshooting system performance within the VMware environment
Analytical skills/understanding complex data
Problem solving skills
Strong customer service skills
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing, in order to discuss/document technical information
Organized and detail oriented with excellent time management skills
Ability to multitask and handle urgent interruptions with poise and professionalism
Flexible availability
VMware Certified Professional (VCP)
Understanding of ITIL Framework and Processes
 
 
Preferred Skills:
Highly skilled in Server Hardware including Dell, HP, etc.
Linux OS experience
Microsoft SQL Server
Microsoft IIS
RSA SecurID two-factor authentication configuration
SFTP Server
ServiceNow – CMDB & Ticketing workflows
Scripting: Microsoft Powershell, vSphere PowerCLI, or comparable scripting experience
Microsoft Certified System Administrator (MCSA) and Cisco Certified Network associate (CCNA) certifications are a plus.
VMware Certified Advanced Professional (VCAP) – (or equivalent advanced training)
S. or M.S. in IT related field, equivalent work experience will be considered
About NICE 
NICE Ltd. (NASDAQ: NICE) software products are used by 25,000+ global businesses, including 85 of the Fortune 100 corporations, to deliver extraordinary customer experiences, fight financial crime and ensure public safety. Every day, NICE software manages more than 120 million customer interactions and monitors 3+ billion financial transactions. 
Known as an innovation powerhouse that excels in AI, cloud and digital, NICE is consistently recognized as the market leader in its domains, with over 8,500 employees across 30+ countries. 
NICE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, neurotype, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other category protected by law.
